title: Platner maintains big lead over Mills in Maine senate race, new poll finds
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Graham Platner leads Janet Mills 64% to 26% in Maine's Democratic Senate primary, according to a UNH poll.
Platner is ahead of incumbent Susan Collins 49% to 38% in a hypothetical general election matchup.
Mills, at 78, would be the oldest first-term U.S. senator; Platner, 41, is a former Marine and political newcomer.

title: R.I. college student dies of carbon monoxide poisoning while charging cellphone in car
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Joseph Boutros, 21, died from carbon monoxide poisoning while charging his cellphone in a snow-blocked vehicle in Newport, R.I.
Newport police and fire responded to Bellevue Avenue for a wellness check, finding Boutros unconscious in the idling car.
A spokesperson from Salve Regina University confirmed Boutros's death and noted the campus community is mourning his loss.

title: Mass. hiker suffering medical emergency rescued from White Mountains
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A 75-year-old hiker from Acton, Mass., experienced a medical emergency at Zealand Hut in White Mountain National Forest.
New Hampshire Fish and Game were notified at 2 a.m. Sunday and initiated a rescue operation for the hiker.
The hiker was assisted down the trail and transported by snowmobile to Route 3, then taken to a hospital.

title: Man arrested for allegedly throwing dog off balcony while drunk in Milford
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Milford police arrested Alex De Oliveira for allegedly throwing a dog off a balcony while intoxicated.
The injured dog was found in a snowbank and taken to Tufts Animal Hospital for treatment.
De Oliveira was charged with animal cruelty, disturbing the peace, and vandalizing property; released on $5,000 bail.

title: 5 takeaways from Eliot Wolf’s press conference at the NFL Scouting Combine
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Eliot Wolf discussed Will Campbell's performance, noting his struggles post-injury despite a strong regular season.
The Patriots debunked rumors about interest in Green Bay's Rasheed Walker, emphasizing the need for tackle depth.
Stefon Diggs's future with the Patriots remains uncertain, with no specific details provided on potential changes.

title: Mass. girl, 11, killed in Utah avalanche while vacationing with family
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Madelyn Eitas, 11, from Rochester, Massachusetts, died in a Utah avalanche while on a ski vacation with her family.
Her brother located her during a frantic search with over 20 people before emergency teams arrived at the scene.
School and community in Rochester are providing support and tributes to honor Madelyn's memory and aid those grieving.

title: Dorchester women injured after snowmobile hits multiple trees in N.H.
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Two Dorchester women injured in a snowmobile crash near Fish Pond, Columbia, New Hampshire.
The 30-year-old first-time operator lost control, striking multiple trees after hitting a snowbank.
Both women were treated at Upper Connecticut Valley Hospital following the crash.

title: Frederick Wiseman, the Bostonian who changed filmmaking forever
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Frederick Wiseman, renowned American documentary filmmaker, died at 96 in February 2026.
Wiseman was known for films like 'Titicut Follies' and 'City Hall', capturing unfiltered realities.
His debut film 'Titicut Follies' was banned in Massachusetts for over 20 years due to its content.

title: Layoffs hit Boston Metal as company plans Woburn shutdown
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Boston Metal is laying off 71 workers and closing Woburn facilities starting March 14 due to financial challenges.
An industrial accident in Brazil caused critical equipment failure, disrupting operations and affecting financing agreements.
Boston Metal aims to concentrate on its metals business in Brazil, while managing reduced revenue and capital constraints.

title: Travelers, did you get stranded due to the blizzard?
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Nearly 1,000 flights were canceled at Logan Airport due to a major nor'easter in New England.
Gov. Maura Healey issued a travel ban on the south coast of Massachusetts amid blizzard conditions.
Amtrak suspended service between Boston and New York due to high winds and heavy snowfall.
